revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-11 08:55:30.000000000', 'message': 'Fix update of trunk subports during live migration

During the live migration trunk subports where updated only based
on the "host_id" field. But when rpc message to update subports
is send trunk's port is still bound to the old host and has
"migrating_to" field in binding:profile set to the new host.
Because of that binding:host_id for the subport's port wasn't updated
proberly and port was set to DOWN on the new host.
That could even cause connectivity break if L2population is used in the
cloud.

This patch fixes that by updating subport's binding:host_id field based
on the migrating_to field if that is available and not empty.

Closes-Bug: #1914747
Change-Id: I98e55242d381ada642ca0729e9aefdea7628c945
(cherry picked from commit e05101c8ac953cc2823b35aaed3d499afc101988)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix update of trunk subports during live migration

During the live migration trunk subports where updated only based
on the "host_id" field. But when rpc message to update subports
is send trunk's port is still bound to the old host and has
"migrating_to" field in binding:profile set to the new host.
Because of that binding:host_id for the subport's port wasn't updated
proberly and port was set to DOWN on the new host.
That could even cause connectivity break if L2population is used in the
cloud.

This patch fixes that by updating subport's binding:host_id field based
on the migrating_to field if that is available and not empty.

Closes-Bug: #1914747
Change-Id: I98e55242d381ada642ca0729e9aefdea7628c945
(cherry picked from commit e05101c8ac953cc2823b35aaed3d499afc101988)

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/775100/1 : FAILURE in 2h 01m 03s'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2021-02-15 09:30:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2021-02-16 08:14:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-02-16 08:48:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2021-02-18 10:11:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-11 08:56:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix update of trunk subports during live migration

During the live migration trunk subports where updated only based
on the "host_id" field. But when rpc message to update subports
is send trunk's port is still bound to the old host and has
"migrating_to" field in binding:profile set to the new host.
Because of that binding:host_id for the subport's port wasn't updated
proberly and port was set to DOWN on the new host.
That could even cause connectivity break if L2population is used in the
cloud.

This patch fixes that by updating subport's binding:host_id field based
on the migrating_to field if that is available and not empty.

Closes-Bug: #1914747
Change-Id: I98e55242d381ada642ca0729e9aefdea7628c945
(cherry picked from commit e05101c8ac953cc2823b35aaed3d499afc101988)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix update of trunk subports during live migration

During the live migration trunk subports where updated only based
on the "host_id" field. But when rpc message to update subports
is send trunk's port is still bound to the old host and has
"migrating_to" field in binding:profile set to the new host.
Because of that binding:host_id for the subport's port wasn't updated
proberly and port was set to DOWN on the new host.
That could even cause connectivity break if L2population is used in the
cloud.

This patch fixes that by updating subport's binding:host_id field based
on the migrating_to field if that is available and not empty.

Closes-Bug: #1914747
Change-Id: I98e55242d381ada642ca0729e9aefdea7628c945
(cherry picked from commit e05101c8ac953cc2823b35aaed3d499afc101988)

commit_message:
Skip test test_migrate_image_after_upgrade

glance_store change[1] causes failure of test_migrate_image_after_upgrade.
A fix[2] has been proposed but would require glance_store to be released
to pass, until then skip it.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/glance_store/+/774703
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/glance/+/776369

Closes-Bug: #1916011
Change-Id: Ie860c63d60b800ecafc4ee655f17c53cc3381c51

(2 comments)

> Patch Set 6:
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> This patch is a big change to the connector.  We need to use some of the third-party CI that currently use the connector to check for regressions.  Looks like these have jobs that use FC and the nvmeof connector:
> 
> - DellEMC Unity CI
> - DellEMC XtremIO CI

This patch is indeed a big change, as discussed in the Cinder PTG meetings and following discussions with the Cinder team.

Besides adding a lot of functionality - support for MDRAID replication, and the ability to share NVMe target connections - this new connector fixes several issues. One KEY issue in the current connector is mentioned inline (current connector line 120)

Due to above mentioned issue, it is hard to believe that anyone is using this connector in a proper enviornment, and we were also not able to find any other CI (besides KIOXIA) that tests the nvmeof connector.

DellEMV XtremeIO CI has previously passed with these connector changes.
DellEMC Unity CI is failing with the following:
FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/opt/stack/new/tempest/.stestr/format'
[Errno 13] Permission denied: '/opt/stack/new/tempest/.stestr'
ERROR: the main setup script run by this job failed - exit code: 1"}, {'account_id': 16721, 'date': '2021-01-30 13:15:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

NVMeOF Connector support MDRAID replication

Also allow multiple volumes per NVMeOF target

commit_message:
Updates to pin charm-tools to 2.8.3

* Update requirements.txt to pin charm-tools to 2.8.3
* Update tox.ini to change the build parameters.
* This upgrades from <2.7 which adds reproducible charms
* Bug was fixed that controlled the default output directory
  doesn't get 'builds' appended.  The tox change puts it
  back so that stable & master both build to the same
  directory.  This may be reviewed in the future.

Change-Id: I6b58bc238641ef26153ac52014f2d6512c77a125

commit_message:
Disallow privilege escalation in rabbitmq server container

This PS is to address security best practices in rabbitmq
server containers by disabling allowPrivilegeEscalation flag

commit_message:
Set availability_zone as part of the cloud-compute relation

A new Juju action, to the nova-cloud-controller charm, will be
added to sync the nova-compute units Juju availability zones with
the availability from OpenStack.

It is useful in the context of a MAAS deployment, in order to map
MAAS AZs to OpenStack AZs.

Change-Id: I62f68f0c0c97aeca20a8afb32095d2972abd8473

subject: CI: publish images on a weekly basis
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-02-17 15:58:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-02-18 13:13:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Review-Priority+1\n\nthe note is overly verbose (all interested parties would know) but let it be'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2021-02-18 13:14:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-17 15:58:48.000000000', 'message': 'CI: publish images on a weekly basis

To better utilise caches during the working week, we decided to publish
only weekly (as opposed to daily).  This is due to DockerHub-imposed
limits.

If published images are broken, or need to be refreshed, then this patch
can be temporarily reverted.

Change-Id: I3916b703e40f0b80c47501ff7faa958b903be05c
'}]
commit_message:
CI: publish images on a weekly basis

To better utilise caches during the working week, we decided to publish
only weekly (as opposed to daily).  This is due to DockerHub-imposed
limits.

If published images are broken, or need to be refreshed, then this patch
can be temporarily reverted.

Change-Id: I3916b703e40f0b80c47501ff7faa958b903be05c

commit_message:
Remove ceph relation

As per the 21.01 release note *1 the ceph relation will be removed
this syscle as it is no longer needed or used.

*1 https://docs.openstack.org/charm-guide/latest/2101.html#rabbitmq-ceph-relation

Change-Id: Ib98abdbd67c2112624fac298cc9dc7683ea29891

commit_message:
ovn: Fix disabling of gateway chassis

It currently runs on hosts in ovn group, and in case that controllers are not
network gateways - it fails on missing openvswitch.

Change-Id: Ibbf683872337402b4e2a38323bb6a3f35ee4bed4

messages:
[{'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2020-12-08 15:38:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2020-12-08 18:09:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded.

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/766023/1 : SUCCESS in 2h 29m 26s'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2020-12-15 14:57:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

recheck + LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2020-12-15 14:59:52.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to backport-hash-check'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2020-12-15 15:23:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/766023/1 : FAILURE in 20m 44s'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-02-10 19:54:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Btw, just for curiosity, shouldn't we pass the DISABLE_CHERRY_PICK_CHECK environment variable in tox?"}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-02-17 11:27:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Whops, I was sure this worked without passenv but testing it now I can see that it doesn't.

Ie8a672fd21184c810bfe9c0e3a49582189bf2111 will sort this out on master and I'll then squash it into this backport."}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-02-17 15:50:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2021-02-17 18:24:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded. For checking Nova with Ceph, add a comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Ceph Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/766023/2/iscsi : SUCCESS in 2h 31m 38s'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-02-18 09:24:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thanks Lee for doing the follow-up, and squashing it to this patch, now cherry-pick check can be disabled with for example:

$ DISABLE_CHERRY_PICK_CHECK=1 tox -e pep8

Trivial tooling backport, I've tested locally and works fine, so I'll fast approve this."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-08 15:38:49.000000000', 'message': "tools: Allow check-cherry-picks.sh to be disabled by an env var

The checks performed by this script aren't always useful to downstream
consumers of the repo so allow them to disable the script without having
to make changes to tox.ini.

Change-Id: I4f551dc4b57905cab8aa005c5680223ad1b57639
(cherry picked from commit 610396f8ad5fe8c3abb7731fcd42c81e5246a938)
"}, {'created': '2021-02-17 15:50:33.000000000', 'message': "tools: Allow check-cherry-picks.sh to be disabled by an env var

The checks performed by this script aren't always useful to downstream
consumers of the repo so allow them to disable the script without having
to make changes to tox.ini.

NOTE(lyarwood): This backport has
Ie8a672fd21184c810bfe9c0e3a49582189bf2111 squashed into it to ensure the
introduced env var is passed into the pep8 tox env.

tox: Add passenv DISABLE_CHERRY_PICK_CHECK to pep8

I4f551dc4b57905cab8aa005c5680223ad1b57639 introduced the environment
variable to disable the check-cherry-pick.sh script but forgot to allow
it to be passed into the pep8 tox env.

Change-Id: I4f551dc4b57905cab8aa005c5680223ad1b57639
(cherry picked from commit 610396f8ad5fe8c3abb7731fcd42c81e5246a938)
"}]
commit_message:
tools: Allow check-cherry-picks.sh to be disabled by an env var

The checks performed by this script aren't always useful to downstream
consumers of the repo so allow them to disable the script without having
to make changes to tox.ini.

NOTE(lyarwood): This backport has
Ie8a672fd21184c810bfe9c0e3a49582189bf2111 squashed into it to ensure the
introduced env var is passed into the pep8 tox env.

tox: Add passenv DISABLE_CHERRY_PICK_CHECK to pep8

I4f551dc4b57905cab8aa005c5680223ad1b57639 introduced the environment
variable to disable the check-cherry-pick.sh script but forgot to allow
it to be passed into the pep8 tox env.

Change-Id: I4f551dc4b57905cab8aa005c5680223ad1b57639
(cherry picked from commit 610396f8ad5fe8c3abb7731fcd42c81e5246a938)

commit_message:
Fix nova db dependency

When I reordered the nova database creation for better performance
and cleaner arrangement, I broke the non-standard arrangement where
the super and cell conductors are squashed together. In devstack,
this is implemented by pointing the controllers at cell1 in the
config, which makes it hard to create and sync the databases in the
natural order. This manifested in a failure when running in this
mode (which apparently Trove is).

As a quick fix, this special-cases the setup for cell0 if that mode
is enabled. I will follow this up with a cleaner refactor of all that
stuff so this hack isn't required, but that will take a bit longer.

Change-Id: I5385157c281beb041bf67cba546be20cf9497cbe

commit_message:
Limit execution of the neutron CI jobs on some irrelevant file

This patch tries to make execution of the CI jobs in the Neutron
queue to be more smart. There is no need to e.g. run
neutron-tempest-plugin-api job when only changed files in patch
are in e.g. neutron.agent module.
Or there is no need to run openvswitch scenario jobs if changes
are in e.g. linuxbridge agent only.

Change-Id: I59acf91e4ce396c35d9939ea4887dde3aef55474

subject: Fix veth pair creation with VLAN interfaces
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-18 10:22:30.000000000', 'message': "Fix veth pair creation with VLAN interfaces

Kayobe creates virtual Ethernet pairs between Linux and OVS bridges for
the Neutron external networks and Ironic provisioning and cleaning
networks. If these networks are defined as VLANs (as is commonly done
for the ironic networks), Kayobe should use the underlying tagged
interface rather than the VLAN interface to plug into the OVS bridge.

The issue being fixed here is that Kayobe does not create virtual
Ethernet pairs for these networks when they are defined as VLANs. This
may have been masked by the fact that typically the neutron external
network is a bridge, and the Ironic networks VLAN interfaces on that
bridge.

Example of a broken setup:

    external_net_names:
      - ext

    provision_wl_net_name: pwl

    other_net_name: br1

    ext_interface: br0

    pwl_interface: br1.42

    br1_interface: br1

This change fixes the issue by checking whether any network has a
bridge interface that matches the VLAN's parent interface.

Change-Id: Iabd57568fe42b27d65c4a858caddd4cadd4e9221
Story: 2008634
Task: 41874
"}]
commit_message:
Fix veth pair creation with VLAN interfaces

Kayobe creates virtual Ethernet pairs between Linux and OVS bridges for
the Neutron external networks and Ironic provisioning and cleaning
networks. If these networks are defined as VLANs (as is commonly done
for the ironic networks), Kayobe should use the underlying tagged
interface rather than the VLAN interface to plug into the OVS bridge.

The issue being fixed here is that Kayobe does not create virtual
Ethernet pairs for these networks when they are defined as VLANs. This
may have been masked by the fact that typically the neutron external
network is a bridge, and the Ironic networks VLAN interfaces on that
bridge.

Example of a broken setup:

    external_net_names:
      - ext

    provision_wl_net_name: pwl

    other_net_name: br1

    ext_interface: br0

    pwl_interface: br1.42

    br1_interface: br1

This change fixes the issue by checking whether any network has a
bridge interface that matches the VLAN's parent interface.

Change-Id: Iabd57568fe42b27d65c4a858caddd4cadd4e9221
Story: 2008634
Task: 41874

commit_message:
Pin cryptograph to < 3.4

This is due to the related bug where cryptography requires a rust
compiler to be able to install from version 4.0 onwards.

Change-Id: I35ab5a7aea95016bdd2bc11e539b44989c17b21a
Related-bug: #1915171

commit_message:
Replace db-sock with db-nb-sock and db-sb-sock

--db-sock JSON-RPC socket name
--db-nb-sock OVN_Northbound db socket
--db-sb-sock OVN_Southbound db socket [1]
so should use db-nb-sock and db-sb-sock

Closes-bug: #1913031

[1] https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn/blob/master/utilities/ovn-ctl

Change-Id: Ife38237a308c87465d5ac3faf7d8de93fd49de4e

If it is not wanted at this time, or if there are more changes that
would be good to get merged before doing a  stable release, please

commit_message:
Release python-senlinclient for stable/train

This release picks up new commits to python-senlinclient since
the last release from stable/train.

This is being proposed as a convenience to help make sure stable
changes are being released. If the team is good with this going out,
please respond with a +1 to let the release team know it is OK to
proceed.

If it is not wanted at this time, or if there are more changes that
would be good to get merged before doing a  stable release, please
leave a -1 with a comment with what the team would prefer. We can
then either abandon this patch, or wait for an update with a new
commit hash to use instead.

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: Id8ba4f890ef8c26c131a0d556ac0747b3d4a838b

Similar to I6f01a178616b74ed9a86876ca46e7e46eb360518, this patch
fixes a compatibility issue when the new connection properties
dictionary exists, but is missing the 'failed_over' field. This
situation may arise when booting a shelved instance whose connection
properties were created prior to when the ScaleIO driver was enhanced
to support replication failover.

Related-Bug: #1823200
Change-Id: I9b2a9cd2839a4efec824fc68cb2163ad70f4ebdc
"}, {'created': '2021-02-16 18:53:46.000000000', 'message': "ScaleIO: More connection info backward compatibility

Similar to I6f01a178616b74ed9a86876ca46e7e46eb360518, this patch
fixes a compatibility issue when the new connection properties
dictionary exists, but is missing the 'failed_over' field. This
situation may arise when booting a shelved instance whose connection
properties were created prior to when the ScaleIO driver was enhanced
to support replication failover.

Related-Bug: #1823200
Change-Id: I9b2a9cd2839a4efec824fc68cb2163ad70f4ebdc

commit_message:
ScaleIO: More connection info backward compatibility

Similar to I6f01a178616b74ed9a86876ca46e7e46eb360518, this patch
fixes a compatibility issue when the new connection properties
dictionary exists, but is missing the 'failed_over' field. This
situation may arise when booting a shelved instance whose connection
properties were created prior to when the ScaleIO driver was enhanced
to support replication failover.

Related-Bug: #1823200
Change-Id: I9b2a9cd2839a4efec824fc68cb2163ad70f4ebdc

commit_message:
[goal] Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file

As per the community goal of migrating the policy file
the format from JSON to YAML[1], we need to do two things:

1. Change the default value of '[oslo_policy] policy_file''
config option from 'policy.json' to 'policy.yaml' with
upgrade checks.

2. Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file on the project side
via warning in doc and releasenotes.

Also replace policy.json to policy.yaml ref from doc.

[1]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/wallaby/migrate-policy-format-from-json-to-yaml.html

Change-Id: I608d3f55dfa9b6052f92c4fd13f2aae6d714e287

subject: Extends REST API for keystone.
messages:
[{'account_id': 26546, 'date': '2019-07-12 12:16:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26546, 'date': '2019-07-12 13:51:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-07-13 12:25:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Before looking at the detail, let me make several general comments.

- Can we assign you to the assignee of the blueprint?
- AngularJS migration is not a project priority now. The priority is just best-effort.

The following things need to be considered when implementing the blueprint (as mentioned in the blueprint whiteboard):

- Django python feature should be kept as default until Angular implementation provides full compatibility.
- The quota management form in the project panel is pluggable for horizon plugin. horizon plugins are allowed to add their own quota form as "tab". For example, manila-ui leverages this. This is a tricky part and I am not sure how we can achieve the compatibility on this, but it should be considered in the AngularJS implementation.'}, {'account_id': 26546, 'date': '2019-07-15 06:14:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 26546, 'date': '2019-07-15 10:40:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi, thanks for the feedback.

 > - Can we assign you to the assignee of the blueprint?
Yep.

 > - AngularJS migration is not a project priority now. The priority
 > is just best-effort.
 I'm aware. I have to make related modifications to the UI however, and I figured this would be the most systematic way of doing it while improving upstream.

 > The following things need to be considered when implementing the
 > blueprint (as mentioned in the blueprint whiteboard):
 > 
 > - Django python feature should be kept as default until Angular
 > implementation provides full compatibility.
How do you mean? Angular features can be turned off and on in settings; they are off by default and the ng-projects implementation should/would/will be the same.

 > - The quota management form in the project panel is pluggable for
 > horizon plugin. horizon plugins are allowed to add their own quota
 > form as "tab". For example, manila-ui leverages this. This is a
 > tricky part and I am not sure how we can achieve the compatibility
 > on this, but it should be considered in the AngularJS
 > implementation.
That depends on what we want to do. A pluggable ng form shouldn't be too difficult to implement. Plugins would have to be updated to make use of the new
mechanism however. I'm not sure trying to bridge the different implementations is a good idea - getting django based forms to render with angular forms
would most likely be (if at all possible) non-trivial and ugly.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2019-07-25 14:00:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2021-02-18 09:38:29.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Akihiro Motoki.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-12 12:16:20.000000000', 'message': 'Extends REST API for keystone.

This patch extends existing REST APIs in preparation for angularization
of the identiy/projects panel.

* An endpoint (with url params) has been added for raw Role Assignments
  for optimized access when building forms
* Created a new REST API class for Project Quota Set access
* Moved EditableQuotaSets endpoint to the new class from nova
* All new and moved endpoints have been covered with tests
* Javascript services which consume these endpoints have been covered
  with jasmine tests

Additionally, some related functionality had missing or broken tests,
which were added/fixed while working on the main functionality.

Change-Id: I35f63c4d6f970260b2d6737f5028780d5937df58
Implements: blueprint ng-projects
'}, {'created': '2019-07-12 13:51:05.000000000', 'message': 'Extends REST API for keystone.

This patch extends existing REST APIs in preparation for angularization
of the identiy/projects panel.

commit_message:
Extends REST API for keystone.

This patch extends existing REST APIs in preparation for angularization
of the identiy/projects panel.

* An endpoint (with url params) has been added for raw Role Assignments
  for optimized access when building forms
* Created a new REST API class for Project Quota Set access
* Moved EditableQuotaSets endpoint to the new class from nova
* All new and moved endpoints have been covered with tests
* Javascript services which consume these endpoints have been covered
  with jasmine tests

Additionally, some related functionality had missing or broken tests,
which were added/fixed while working on the main functionality.

Change-Id: I35f63c4d6f970260b2d6737f5028780d5937df58
Implements: blueprint ng-projects

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-09 18:27:36.000000000', 'message': "Fix iter bug which causes test failure and crash

The following change adjusts the list comprehension to copy the
constraints object when iterating to resolve an issue where the
list changes its size during the iteration. Without this change
we're running into the following python stacktrace.

> Set changed size during iteration [0]

This change adds the copy import to ensure we're able to respect
any compound object that may be passed through the parent.

[0] http://paste.openstack.org/show/802486
Change-Id: Ia25b8443bbe576f73fb7debe54f307deadf34e04
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2021-02-17 13:14:43.000000000', 'message': "Fix iter bug which causes test failure and crash

The following change adjusts the list comprehension to copy the
constraints object when iterating to resolve an issue where the
list changes its size during the iteration. Without this change
we're running into the following python stacktrace.

> Set changed size during iteration [0]

This change adds the copy import to ensure we're able to respect
any compound object that may be passed through the parent.

[0] http://paste.openstack.org/show/802486
Change-Id: Ia25b8443bbe576f73fb7debe54f307deadf34e04
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2021-02-18 04:30:26.000000000', 'message': 'Fix iter bug with SQlAlchemy 1.3.23

With SQlAlchemy 1.3.23 constraint.copy() fails with error[0].
This seems like a regression after[1].

This patch fixes the issue by providing the ``target_table``
argument to c.copy().

[0] http://paste.openstack.org/show/802486
[1] https://github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/commit/7dd3381edb15e9699d24d78caa8a1021667ce92d

Change-Id: Ia25b8443bbe576f73fb7debe54f307deadf34e04
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix iter bug with SQlAlchemy 1.3.23

With SQlAlchemy 1.3.23 constraint.copy() fails with error[0].
This seems like a regression after[1].

This patch fixes the issue by providing the ``target_table``
argument to c.copy().

[0] http://paste.openstack.org/show/802486
[1] https://github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/commit/7dd3381edb15e9699d24d78caa8a1021667ce92d

Change-Id: Ia25b8443bbe576f73fb7debe54f307deadf34e04
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:

Should be formed as:

  {'hosts': 'ALL',
   'reason': None,
   'lp': None}
}

subject: WIP: Add tox_constraints_opt variable to lower-constraints job
messages:
[{'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2020-12-10 10:30:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2020-12-10 10:33:29.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to constrain-tox-install'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2020-12-10 11:47:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2021-02-18 08:04:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Could you explain how this works?
When tox_constraints_file is passed to the tox role, it sets TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE to the environment where tox is run. On the other hand, In most OpenStack projects, TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is referred only in normal UT jobs like py38 [1] and it is not referred in the lower-constraints tox env [2].

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/src/branch/master/tox.ini#L17
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/src/branch/master/tox.ini#L252'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-10 10:30:22.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Add tox_constraints_opt variable to lower-constraints job

This patch sets constraints for installing tox so that virtualenv and
others are installed with the supported versions on a given stable
branch.

Change-Id: Ic2f0e16f4a21b57d45cbed1fde87c3c8ea6d3112

commit_message:
WIP: Add tox_constraints_opt variable to lower-constraints job

This patch sets constraints for installing tox so that virtualenv and
others are installed with the supported versions on a given stable
branch.

Change-Id: Ic2f0e16f4a21b57d45cbed1fde87c3c8ea6d3112

subject: fix: order tags to be sure to favor release tag over pre-release tags
messages:
[{'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2021-02-10 14:19:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2021-02-10 14:27:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

The code changes look good. I have one question about the comment that's included, though."}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2021-02-10 14:42:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2021-02-10 14:43:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
fix: order tags to be sure to favor release tag over pre-release tags

When a commit matches multiple tags, it's usually preferable to select the
release tag. The typical use case is tagging a release candidate and then
tagging it with the release tag with no new commits.

Change-Id: I77ae7c2d5716430bb0a83d4f1ff82c75a8b695d6

commit_message:
Move some raid specific functions to raid_utils

To reduce size of the hardware module and separate the raid specific
code in raid_utils, we move some functions and adapt the tests.

Change-Id: I73f6cf118575b627e66727d88d5567377c1999a0

[{'created': '2020-12-03 22:14:50.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Disable output cache

Qemu-img, my default in convert, creates an output buffer
cache to assemble the blocks to efficently stream them to
the block device.

This reduces the amount of memory qemu-img tries to grab to start-up
and reduces the chances of it failing due to the memory limit.

Change-Id: Iaaf1a7e78e3f28443d2b5a80a194776de6ebc5fc
'}, {'created': '2020-12-04 21:36:56.000000000', 'message': 'Disable output cache

Qemu-img, my default in convert, creates an output buffer
cache to assemble the blocks to efficently stream them to
the block device.

This reduces the amount of memory qemu-img tries to grab to start-up
and reduces the chances of it failing due to the memory limit.

Basic testing reveals this reduces the qemu-img failure rate by
approximately 50% when converting a 1.1GB compressed image to
raw format where the machine was hovering around 970MB of
completely free memory at any given time.

Please note: While a system may have 10GB of memory available, with 9GB
being used by caches/buffers, less than 1 GB may be avaialble for an
immediate free memory allocation. By default, the process allocation is
1GB.

Change-Id: Iaaf1a7e78e3f28443d2b5a80a194776de6ebc5fc
'}]
commit_message:
Disable output cache

Qemu-img, my default in convert, creates an output buffer
cache to assemble the blocks to efficently stream them to
the block device.

This reduces the amount of memory qemu-img tries to grab to start-up
and reduces the chances of it failing due to the memory limit.

Basic testing reveals this reduces the qemu-img failure rate by
approximately 50% when converting a 1.1GB compressed image to
raw format where the machine was hovering around 970MB of
completely free memory at any given time.

Please note: While a system may have 10GB of memory available, with 9GB
being used by caches/buffers, less than 1 GB may be avaialble for an
immediate free memory allocation. By default, the process allocation is
1GB.

Change-Id: Iaaf1a7e78e3f28443d2b5a80a194776de6ebc5fc

[{'created': '2021-02-11 21:46:44.000000000', 'message': "Bump up timeouts for DSVM and probe test jobs

DSVM recently got a bunch more middlewares enabled, so it's running more
tests than it used to.

I can't think of much that's changed for probe tests, but I feel like
I've seen it popping timeouts more often lately.

Note that the new timeouts are still lower than the typical run-time of
our longest-running jobs (currently grenade / tempest-ipv6-only).

Change-Id: Iffbb567124096df02b04981550faec8204d5d1ec
Related-Change: I3cbbcd2ea9ced0923bee4a6b0783e4cf5e82e95b
(cherry picked from commit 67598b3a4a6f841726b7358245ae18edbfc58250)
"}]
commit_message:
Bump up timeouts for DSVM and probe test jobs

DSVM recently got a bunch more middlewares enabled, so it's running more
tests than it used to.

I can't think of much that's changed for probe tests, but I feel like
I've seen it popping timeouts more often lately.

Note that the new timeouts are still lower than the typical run-time of
our longest-running jobs (currently grenade / tempest-ipv6-only).

Change-Id: Iffbb567124096df02b04981550faec8204d5d1ec
Related-Change: I3cbbcd2ea9ced0923bee4a6b0783e4cf5e82e95b
(cherry picked from commit 67598b3a4a6f841726b7358245ae18edbfc58250)

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-09-26 15:26:22.000000000', 'message': "Replace retrying with tenacity

We are replacing all usages of the 'retrying' package with
'tenacity' as the author of retrying is not actively maintaining
the project. Tenacity is a fork of retrying, but has improved the
interface and extensibility (see [1] for more details). Our end
goal here is removing the retrying package from our requirements.

Tenacity provides the same functionality as retrying, but has the
following major differences to account for:
- Tenacity uses seconds rather than ms as retrying did.
- Tenacity has different kwargs for the decorator and
Retrying class itself.
- Tenacity has a different approach for retrying args by
using classes for its stop/wait/retry kwargs.
- By default tenacity raises a RetryError if a retried callable
times out; retrying raises the last exception from the callable.
Tenacity provides backwards compatibility here by offering
the 'reraise' kwarg.
- Tenacity defines 'time.sleep' as a default value for a kwarg.
That said consumers who need to mock patch time.sleep
need to account for this via mocking of time.sleep before
tenacity is imported.
- For retries that check a result, tenacity will raise if the retried
function raises, whereas retrying retried on all exceptions.

This patch updates all usages of retrying with tenacity.
Unit tests will be added where applicable.

Note: This change is not newton critical so projects are welcome
to hold off on committing until post-newton. Ideally this change
will merge by the first part of Ocata so dependant functionality
can land and have time to solidify for Ocata.

[1] https://github.com/jd/tenacity

Change-Id: Ie5eb3ddc196505e8f58ed14de9952284598586fb

"}, {'created': '2020-09-01 16:34:29.000000000', 'message': "Replace retrying with tenacity

We are replacing all usages of the 'retrying' package with
'tenacity' as the author of retrying is not actively maintaining
the project. Tenacity is a fork of retrying, but has improved the
interface and extensibility (see [1] for more details). Our end
goal here is removing the retrying package from our requirements.

Tenacity provides the same functionality as retrying, but has the
following major differences to account for:
- Tenacity uses seconds rather than ms as retrying did.
- Tenacity has different kwargs for the decorator and
Retrying class itself.
- Tenacity has a different approach for retrying args by
using classes for its stop/wait/retry kwargs.
- By default tenacity raises a RetryError if a retried callable
times out; retrying raises the last exception from the callable.
Tenacity provides backwards compatibility here by offering
the 'reraise' kwarg.
- Tenacity defines 'time.sleep' as a default value for a kwarg.
That said consumers who need to mock patch time.sleep
need to account for this via mocking of time.sleep before
tenacity is imported.
- For retries that check a result, tenacity will raise if the retried
function raises, whereas retrying retried on all exceptions.

This patch updates all usages of retrying with tenacity.
Unit tests will be added/removed where applicable.

[1] https://github.com/jd/tenacity

BLOCKED BY
    https://github.com/jd/tenacity/issues/228

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <dtantsur@protonmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Riccardo Pittau <elfosardo@gmail.com>
Story: #1635390
Task: #10528
Change-Id: Ie5eb3ddc196505e8f58ed14de9952284598586fb

"}, {'created': '2021-01-18 13:23:50.000000000', 'message': "Replace retrying with tenacity

We are replacing all usages of the 'retrying' package with
'tenacity' as the author of retrying is not actively maintaining
the project.
Unit tests will be added/removed where applicable.

Tenacity [1] is a fork of retrying, but has improved the
interface and extensibility.
Our end goal here is removing the retrying package from our
requirements.

Tenacity provides the same functionality as retrying, but has the
following major differences to account for:
- Tenacity uses seconds rather than ms as retrying did.
- Tenacity has different kwargs for the decorator and
Retrying class itself.
- Tenacity has a different approach for retrying args by
using classes for its stop/wait/retry kwargs.
- By default tenacity raises a RetryError if a retried callable
times out; retrying raises the last exception from the callable.
Tenacity provides backwards compatibility here by offering
the 'reraise' kwarg.
- For retries that check a result, tenacity will raise if the retried
function raises, whereas retrying retried on all exceptions.

[1] https://github.com/jd/tenacity

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <dtantsur@protonmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Riccardo Pittau <elfosardo@gmail.com>
Story: #1635390
Task: #10528
Change-Id: Ie5eb3ddc196505e8f58ed14de9952284598586fb

commit_message:
Replace retrying with tenacity

We are replacing all usages of the 'retrying' package with
'tenacity' as the author of retrying is not actively maintaining
the project.
Unit tests will be added/removed where applicable.

Tenacity [1] is a fork of retrying, but has improved the
interface and extensibility.
Our end goal here is removing the retrying package from our
requirements.

Tenacity provides the same functionality as retrying, but has the
following major differences to account for:
- Tenacity uses seconds rather than ms as retrying did.
- Tenacity has different kwargs for the decorator and
Retrying class itself.
- Tenacity has a different approach for retrying args by
using classes for its stop/wait/retry kwargs.
- By default tenacity raises a RetryError if a retried callable
times out; retrying raises the last exception from the callable.
Tenacity provides backwards compatibility here by offering
the 'reraise' kwarg.
- For retries that check a result, tenacity will raise if the retried
function raises, whereas retrying retried on all exceptions.

[1] https://github.com/jd/tenacity

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <dtantsur@protonmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Riccardo Pittau <elfosardo@gmail.com>
Story: #1635390
Task: #10528
Change-Id: Ie5eb3ddc196505e8f58ed14de9952284598586fb

subject: Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria
messages:
[{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2021-01-14 13:48:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2021-01-15 12:35:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

CI failure is caused by the centos-8 nodesets using a bad wheel index URL, it's using  https://mirror.bhs1.ovh.opendev.org/wheel/centos-8.3-x86_64 instead of  https://mirror.bhs1.ovh.opendev.org/wheel/centos-8-x86_64

This means that it won't find the wheel file for alembic (CI installing 1.4.2 and pypi only has .whl for for 1.4.3), so the system tries to build from the .tar.gz and fails.

I have no idea how to fix the URL issue.  I have asked in #openstack-infra and I'm waiting for someone to reply."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-02-17 17:38:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-02-17 19:59:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I8baf95cf3cee122cac201facd672e683c2b0d5f9
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I8baf95cf3cee122cac201facd672e683c2b0d5f9

commit_message:
Server tabs: add policy enforcement for tab display

We have nova policies for all of these so should observe them. Otherwise
if a user e.g. doesn't have rights to view the console log of a VM they
will get an error every time they click on an instance name.

Change-Id: I78bb67621c4c0aea0a06bf10e9fe07a618ce8766

commit_message:
Support policy checks in the Tab base class

Many tabs are populated via API calls; we should have a way
to check if those calls will fail before displaying the tab.

Change-Id: I2968f611b2ae49bfb66d74e32dc9729eaa447f4c

commit_message:
Move cinder to new hacking 4.0.0

This patch changes old assert checks in tacker unit test cases to new
optimal assert checks provided by hacking plugin in release 4.0.0.
Please refer [1] for optimal assert checks details.

The patch modifies following,
 * Changes assertTrue(isinstance(A, B)) to assertIsInstance(A, B).

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/hacking/unreleased.html#relnotes-4-0-0

Change-Id: I41f52a7f27b8a7c45e1e519129e19a386c922733

Thanks. Don't we usually need to update requirements first though? https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/src/commit/ed019e17dfc136092fe55ff41e2570f566e320e9/global-requirements.txt#L196"}, {'account_id': 31882, 'date': '2021-02-18 01:56:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yes, usually we should update openstack/requirements first. But it seems that we hit some CI upgrade issue there. https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/774368

Stephen has a patch https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/774917 But there is still some issue.

Then Cliff bumped the version by hand: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cliff/+/774915/1

Let block this patch until the problem in  openstack/requirements is fixed. Or auomaton can do the same as Cliff"}, {'account_id': 31882, 'date': '2021-02-18 02:30:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Oh, due to the CI issues in openstack/requirements, I think we should uncap the version limit in automaton first, like what Cliff did.'}, {'account_id': 31882, 'date': '2021-02-18 02:46:42.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Just find that automaton has uncap the limit already https://opendev.org/openstack/automaton/commit/406007e43eb48f959b25699423e9826b23ebe760'}]

commit_message:
Remove PrettyTable version limit

PrettyTable library is alive now. It has newer version already.

So it's good to keep the library newer.

Change-Id: I2a09920c988dd49943eda5e11a8a259d868d0169

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-05 22:44:22.000000000', 'message': 'Add stable branch jobs on the plugins master gate

Supported stable branches in maintenance state
(stein, train, ussuri) use the Tempest and plugins master
version for their testing. To make sure master version (new
tests or any changes) is compatible with stable branch testing,
we need to add the stable branches job on the plugins master gate.
Tempest and many other plugins are already testing the stable
branches in same way[1].

Ussuri onwards, Tempest or plugins are py3 only, so we are
running only python3 version of stable jobs

Tempest plugins guide for stable branch testing:
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_testing_policy.html

 [1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/src/commit/e8f1876aa6772077f85f380677b30251c2454505/.zuul.yaml#L646

Change-Id: I31798ce47063a55e6ef29d713dc156c2d873e3cb
'}]
commit_message:
Add stable branch jobs on the plugins master gate

Supported stable branches in maintenance state
(stein, train, ussuri) use the Tempest and plugins master
version for their testing. To make sure master version (new
tests or any changes) is compatible with stable branch testing,
we need to add the stable branches job on the plugins master gate.
Tempest and many other plugins are already testing the stable
branches in same way[1].

Ussuri onwards, Tempest or plugins are py3 only, so we are
running only python3 version of stable jobs

Tempest plugins guide for stable branch testing:
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_testing_policy.html

 [1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/src/commit/e8f1876aa6772077f85f380677b30251c2454505/.zuul.yaml#L646

Change-Id: I31798ce47063a55e6ef29d713dc156c2d873e3cb

[{'created': '2021-02-17 02:35:03.000000000', 'message': '[DNM] test devstack async setup

Latest devstack is supporting async (palallel) task.[1]
[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/771505

This patch tests async task for the following effects:
* Resolve the RETRY_LIMIT error that is occurring on FT
* Reduce test time

Change-Id: I7bb116f80d6327257257ec8e1eebc0bd95d109a0
'}, {'created': '2021-02-17 05:35:47.000000000', 'message': '[DNM] test devstack async setup

Latest devstack is supporting async (parallel) task.[1]
[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/771505

This patch tests async task for the following effects:
* Resolve the RETRY_LIMIT error that is occurring on FT
* Reduce test time

Change points (zuul.yaml):
* Add DEVSTACK_PARALLEL to True
* Removed CELLSV2_SETUP (comment outed)

Change-Id: I7bb116f80d6327257257ec8e1eebc0bd95d109a0
'}, {'created': '2021-02-17 08:08:40.000000000', 'message': 'Resolve FT error in Zuul and reduce times

Latest devstack is supporting async (parallel) task.[1]
[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/771505

This patch change to use async task for the following effects:
* Resolve the `RETRY_LIMIT` error that is occurring on FT
* Reduce time of functional test in Zuul

Change points of .zuul.yaml:
* For async task, I added the `DEVSTACK_PARALLEL` parameter and set it
  to True.
* Removed `CELLSV2_SETUP: singleconductor` to avoid FT error that is
  caused by nova db dependency issues. (Changed to work with the
  recommended default value `supperconductor` by commenting out)

Change-Id: I7bb116f80d6327257257ec8e1eebc0bd95d109a0
'}, {'created': '2021-02-17 18:41:34.000000000', 'message': 'Resolve FT error in Zuul and reduce times

Latest devstack is supporting async (parallel) task.[1]
[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/771505

This patch change to use async task for the following effects:
* Resolve the `RETRY_LIMIT` error that is occurring on FT
* Reduce time of functional test in Zuul

Change points of .zuul.yaml:
* For async task, I added the `DEVSTACK_PARALLEL` parameter and set it
  to True.
* Removed `CELLSV2_SETUP: singleconductor` to avoid FT error that is
  caused by nova db dependency issues. (Changed to work with the
  recommended default value `supperconductor`)

Change-Id: I7bb116f80d6327257257ec8e1eebc0bd95d109a0
'}]
commit_message:
Resolve FT error in Zuul and reduce times

Latest devstack is supporting async (parallel) task.[1]
[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/771505

This patch change to use async task for the following effects:
* Resolve the `RETRY_LIMIT` error that is occurring on FT
* Reduce time of functional test in Zuul

Change points of .zuul.yaml:
* For async task, I added the `DEVSTACK_PARALLEL` parameter and set it
  to True.
* Removed `CELLSV2_SETUP: singleconductor` to avoid FT error that is
  caused by nova db dependency issues. (Changed to work with the
  recommended default value `supperconductor`)

Change-Id: I7bb116f80d6327257257ec8e1eebc0bd95d109a0

commit_message:
Pass correct port data to extension manager

The CRUD methods in the ML2 plugin must pass the data in the request
body to the extension manager, so it can be processed by all the ML2
extensions enabled in the deployment. The create_port_bulk method is
instead passing the dictionary generated after adding the port to the
DB. This will cause that fields in the request body intended for
extensions will not be processed.

Change-Id: I2fe8e2b98c05ba739e9e93b4bd5880eb97bdaef8
(cherry picked from commit 9c5156575dccf632195da2d25598bfce2823c3fa)

CI failure is caused by the centos-8 nodesets using a bad wheel index URL, it's using  https://mirror.bhs1.ovh.opendev.org/wheel/centos-8.3-x86_64 instead of  https://mirror.bhs1.ovh.opendev.org/wheel/centos-8-x86_64

This means that it won't find the wheel file for alembic (CI installing 1.4.2 and pypi only has .whl for for 1.4.3), so the system tries to build from the .tar.gz and fails.

I have no idea how to fix the URL issue.  I have asked in #openstack-infra and I'm waiting for someone to reply."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-02-17 15:06:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The error looks doesn't relate to this patch.

ERROR: No matching distribution found for docutils>=0.12"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2021-02-08 13:12:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> The error looks doesn't relate to this patch.
> 
> ERROR: No matching distribution found for docutils>=0.12

It is related. The pip resolver is not able to find a compatible version based on the current constraints. Those will need to be sorted out, and other versions updated, before this can be updated."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-02-09 16:44:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-02-09 16:44:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

We're removing lower-constraints entirely, so I've rebased onto that patch. Hopefully this'll resolve the issue"}, {'account_id': 31882, 'date': '2021-02-10 09:00:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Oh, thanks for the fix.

How do you think about this change? Acutally there are still many openstack projects need be updated. I'd like to get your thought before commit more PATCH."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-02-10 09:22:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> Oh, thanks for the fix.
> 
> How do you think about this change? Acutally there are still many openstack projects need be updated. I'd like to get your thought before commit more PATCH.

It's a good idea, however, I'm surprised this works. I had a local patch to do this and had bumped the minimum to 2.0.0. It then started failing some tests since the wrapping worked differently. I need to test this locally and see why it's passing here yet it didn't pass in my change"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-02-10 14:43:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Yes, this isn't actually doing what you think it is. That's because the upper-constraints.txt file in the openstack/requirements project is capping this. If I download this and run tox, it will install the 0.7.2 version. If you force install a newer version then the tests fail as I was seeing before. You need to get that fixed first and ideally bump the minimum to a newer version, e.g. 2.0.0"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-02-10 18:05:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Okay, I solved the issue in [1]. If it's okay with you, I'm going to go with that approach. Do please continue to work on resolving this issue with other projects though. Note that I've pushed a change to remove the upper bound from the requirements project [2] which will allow you to actually use the newer version once you remove the cap.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cliff/+/774915/1
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/774917"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-02-11 11:05:28.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 31882, 'date': '2021-02-18 01:49:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> Okay, I solved the issue in [1]. If it's okay with you, I'm going to go with that approach. Do please continue to work on resolving this issue with other projects though. Note that I've pushed a change to remove the upper bound from the requirements project [2] which will allow you to actually use the newer version once you remove the cap.
> 
> [1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cliff/+/774915/1
> [2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/774917

Thanks! Nice change"}]

commit_message:
Remove PrettyTable version limit

PrettyTable library is alive and released newer version now. It's good to keep the
library newer.

Once a newer version of PrettyTable package is added to some OS like Ubuntu/CentOS,
Keeping using the old version will block openstack RPM/DEB package build.

Story: 2008435
Change-Id: I501bc910db4cb3338e095083d74f9250025c8c66

commit_message:
Revert "Temporary make rally job non-voting"

This reverts commit 9651c635b7ab412074b9366633a8bd20589ef91e.

Reason for revert: oslo.policy 3.6.1 have fix for our performance
degradation when secure rbac are used. So it is good to make rally
job voting again.

Change-Id: I6839a1c98ea00d827ba54e86864c3faa6bb3a031

commit_message:
Update ovs agent to support host/label overrides

In the ovs agent code, some of the secret ref are hardcoded, and
it breaks the host/label overrides mechanism.  This patchset
fixes it.

Change-Id: Icf3ffc86fde77b1948e86cfd62e83fbdfe16ad8e

commit_message:
Spec: Re-factor Account Generator

Refactor the account generator function into two processes that
can be run independantly. This will provide more testing flexibility
and customization without changing the current functionality.

Add the ability to:
create account_file.yaml without creating resources
create resources from provided files
verify provided files

Change-Id: I16a30c49c3b8c6e562594fef987db58b65f2219d

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-15 06:10:39.000000000', 'message': 'Stop NetworkManager from updating resolv.conf

cloud-init creates /etc/NetworkManager/conf.d/99-cloud-init.conf,
for NetworkManager to not update resolv.conf. However, subsequent
update of NetworkManager seems to remove that file as there is no
config(noreplace) directive for it. So after an update/upgrade of
overcloud nodes, reboot would cleanup the dns entries.

cloud-init do configuration only one time during first instance
boot. So this would ensure resolv.conf is not touched during
subsequent reboots.

Change-Id: I989e3f1d14fd33e97933032111cf48166dc5f50c
(cherry picked from commit 6881079d12a9fb2cf752a5f56116c1b4d3a7b75d)

commit_message:
Stop NetworkManager from updating resolv.conf

cloud-init creates /etc/NetworkManager/conf.d/99-cloud-init.conf,
for NetworkManager to not update resolv.conf. However, subsequent
update of NetworkManager seems to remove that file as there is no
config(noreplace) directive for it. So after an update/upgrade of
overcloud nodes, reboot would cleanup the dns entries.

cloud-init do configuration only one time during first instance
boot. So this would ensure resolv.conf is not touched during
subsequent reboots.

Change-Id: I989e3f1d14fd33e97933032111cf48166dc5f50c
(cherry picked from commit 6881079d12a9fb2cf752a5f56116c1b4d3a7b75d)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-15 10:19:36.000000000', 'message': 'Allow rhsm subscription test to be overrided in RHOSP deployment.

This allow the master playbook used for update to set
tripleo_redhat_enforce to false on a per role basis on Red Hat
environment.

The default in defaults/main.yml is now "true" so that it keeps its
behavior of being run by default if nothing is changed in the role
definition.

We then avoid running it on other plateform than Red Hat by adding an
explicit test in that tasks/main.yml file.

Overall the behavior is as follows:

  | Red Hat Env | tripleo_enforced     | Test run |
  |-------------+----------------------+----------|
  | True        | Unset                | Yes      |
  | True        | Set to true in role  | Yes      |
  | True        | Set to false in role | No       |
  | False       | Doesn't matter       | No       |

Change-Id: I6268a01d16f8288bf862003d19184fc93b88282a
Partial-Bug: #1912512
(cherry picked from commit a7826cc8404e72c59302e38876f88347b845b40c)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow rhsm subscription test to be overrided in RHOSP deployment.

This allow the master playbook used for update to set
tripleo_redhat_enforce to false on a per role basis on Red Hat
environment.

The default in defaults/main.yml is now "true" so that it keeps its
behavior of being run by default if nothing is changed in the role
definition.

We then avoid running it on other plateform than Red Hat by adding an
explicit test in that tasks/main.yml file.

Overall the behavior is as follows:

  | Red Hat Env | tripleo_enforced     | Test run |
  |-------------+----------------------+----------|
  | True        | Unset                | Yes      |
  | True        | Set to true in role  | Yes      |
  | True        | Set to false in role | No       |
  | False       | Doesn't matter       | No       |

Change-Id: I6268a01d16f8288bf862003d19184fc93b88282a
Partial-Bug: #1912512
(cherry picked from commit a7826cc8404e72c59302e38876f88347b845b40c)

commit_message:
Add ContainerDefaultPidsLimit to set default pid limits in containers.conf

Starting With podman 2.X the default pids-limits has been halved from
4096 to 2048 (see the dep-on change Id5d5fb9d20c0295763c78171190b9eda13508617 for
more details).

Let's add a parameter to override this value so an operator can raise
this limit globally.

Depends-On: Id5d5fb9d20c0295763c78171190b9eda13508617
Change-Id: I38a72609e6495b979861105f321b5730669a6a2b
(cherry picked from commit 781beb757121c3b3e535af6d2240163e58a33ddd)
(cherry picked from commit 3ac51218f730685016fc7f4d92d90481600d3396)
(cherry picked from commit c77472ec3b4ca5f280cb54697113d98af4171ce1)

commit_message:
Update String type for Monasca ES template

This updates the Elasticsearch template used by Monasca to
persist logs so that is uses the 'new' string types [1]. As
an aside it helps to make the template more clear; full text
search for log messages, and keyword searches for everything
else.

[1] https://www.elastic.co/blog/strings-are-dead-long-live-strings

Closes-Bug: #1892376
Change-Id: I0cd6bf22d4695d88d93241da4364d170d8d8c80e
(cherry picked from commit d3e87a2e4d8b2ca6f03d0c19f3f3d619b52d5514)

commit_message:
Use absolute path for uwsgi_params include

Nginx config verification that is performed by ansible [1] is made
in tmp "on fly" which fails because of the relative import.

We also move task that replaces ports for nginx.conf to the end
so that config validation was accomplished after all configurations
are applied.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_keystone/src/branch/master/tasks/keystone_nginx.yml#L44

Change-Id: Ic52fc7dbdb0324ab8f4b71d25398f23a05df05d7
(cherry picked from commit e377209297dd359c2191c8b1c23eae2ca21fe5eb)

rabbitmq chart deployment is successful with this PS in my local vm.

kubectl get pods -n openstack | grep "rabbitmq" | grep "Running"
rabbitmq-rabbitmq-0                            1/1     Running     1          6m22s
rabbitmq-rabbitmq-1                            1/1     Running     0          6m22s
rabbitmq-rabbitmq-exporter-7f6798784b-thfh2    1/1     Running     0          6m22s


kubectl get pods rabbitmq-rabbitmq-0 -n openstack -o yaml | grep "  containers:" -A80 | grep "name: rabbitmq" -A30 | grep "securityContext:" -A3
    securityContext:
      allowPrivilegeEscalation: false
      readOnlyRootFilesystem: false
      runAsUser: 999

kubectl exec -it rabbitmq-rabbitmq-0 -n openstack bash

commit_message:
Disallow privilege escalation in rabbitmq server container

This PS is to address security best practices in rabbitmq
server containers by disabling allowPrivilegeEscalation flag

Change-Id: I4de2ee4320efaa9569312016f4cca61c1f7636b2

commit_message:
Configure rsyslog on Octavia service nodes in devstack

{admin,tenant}_log_targets options are configured with
MGMT_PORT_IP in devstack, which contains the IP address
of the local management interface. In multinode setup,
it means that the second node should run a rsyslog
service to receive logs from amphorae that have been
spawned by its worker.

Change-Id: If2841720009c2e402127e2e0080efdd56b68f6c9

commit_message:
[OSC] Implement Share Revert Command

This patch adds the 'openstack share revert' command,
which implements the same functionality as 'manila revert-to-snapshot'
and can be used to revert a share to a specified snapshot.

Partially-implements bp openstack-client-support
Change-Id: I896f2bb4ae256dda637768672f833573f5c2475d

(4 comments)

Thank you for updating the change. -1 because of inconsistencies between actual change and release note. Sorry I miss missing parameter during my previous review.

Also, this discussion might be applied to any change in puppet-nova, I feel like it's too much to copy-paste whole parameter description in puppet-nova and tripleo-heat-templates. This would requires us to keep these description consistent with nova, and I'm wondering whether we can more short and simple explanation in tht. (I don't think this discussion should block the change but I'm just asking your thoughts.)"}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-02-09 17:14:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-02-09 17:17:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

(4 comments)

> Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1
> 
> (4 comments)
> 
> Thank you for updating the change. -1 because of inconsistencies between actual change and release note. Sorry I miss missing parameter during my previous review.
> 
> Also, this discussion might be applied to any change in puppet-nova, I feel like it's too much to copy-paste whole parameter description in puppet-nova and tripleo-heat-templates. This would requires us to keep these description consistent with nova, and I'm wondering whether we can more short and simple explanation in tht. (I don't think this discussion should block the change but I'm just asking your thoughts.)

Nice catch Takashi-san. I forgot to update the releasenotes.

While I agree that this is duplication of work, operators are not really consulting the puppet manifests unless they can't find something in TripleO. I think THT made a good job at documenting the parameters so far and it's very helpful and insightful to have them on hands like that, where operators spend most of their time.

That's just my opinion.

Thanks,

DVD"}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-02-10 12:13:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Code-Review+1

Thank you for the quick fix. I thought you would implement NovaComputeImageCacheRemoveUnusedOriginalMinimumAge as well but I'm ok without that.

Regarding the parameter description I understand what you mentioned and agree to it. What we are discussing is a kind of tradeoff between usability and maintainability so I think both have their owne pros/cons. Because we already have several parameters with long original parameter descriptions, I'll leave +1 here and see whether any other folks has strong opinion about this. (Anyway I don't have +2 for tht atm)"}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2021-02-11 07:39:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2021-02-11 09:37:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Introducing parametrable storage configuration

Operators might be interested in configuring these settings.
Having them as parameters with clear description will help with their
environment optimization.

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/1923216

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/757079/
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/757871/

Change-Id: Ib14252e1cb48f9b2017537eaa0ceac029e509979

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-17 13:44:06.000000000', 'message': 'Dropping lower constraints testing

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this
topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

I propose to drop this test because the complexity and recurring pain needed
to maintain that now exceeds the benefits provided by this mechanismes.

Also removing lower constraints and related tox environment as they are
no longer needed.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html

Conflicts:
  .zuul.yaml
  lower-constraints.txt
  tox.ini

NOTE(hberaud): Conflicts are due to different base jobs in zuul, diff on tox
targets in tox.ini, and different constraints in lower-constraints

Change-Id: Icf48ef72fbfff88dda2714b386dbbfe355dc1acb
(cherry picked from commit 686a8b61826d9bed0a989e645a13c708c3e6343c)
(cherry picked from commit 1682ef69ae30732071fb4296f947047c37c4622e)
(cherry picked from commit 7e151b15b949e00e5d6a1b6ba93c4fbbb38274bc)
'}]
commit_message:
Dropping lower constraints testing

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this
topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

I propose to drop this test because the complexity and recurring pain needed
to maintain that now exceeds the benefits provided by this mechanismes.

Also removing lower constraints and related tox environment as they are
no longer needed.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html

Conflicts:
  .zuul.yaml
  lower-constraints.txt
  tox.ini

NOTE(hberaud): Conflicts are due to different base jobs in zuul, diff on tox
targets in tox.ini, and different constraints in lower-constraints

Change-Id: Icf48ef72fbfff88dda2714b386dbbfe355dc1acb
(cherry picked from commit 686a8b61826d9bed0a989e645a13c708c3e6343c)
(cherry picked from commit 1682ef69ae30732071fb4296f947047c37c4622e)
(cherry picked from commit 7e151b15b949e00e5d6a1b6ba93c4fbbb38274bc)

Add ALPN support to load balancer pools

This adds property 'alpn_protocols' to load balancer pools.

commit_message:
Fix type of direct_mandatory_flag opt

An IntOpt with a default of True is invalid. I'm a little surprised
this doesn't fail a defaults check somewhere, but it needs to be
fixed regardless.

Looking at where it is used, it appears the boolean type is correct.
This just changes the opt type to BoolOpt to match.

Change-Id: I01a38754a31c891f2b3b9c7f8135690693df5d13
Closes-Bug: 1909036
(cherry picked from commit b8f8b17030e93f6fe64e986ebae1de4011f007d5)
(cherry picked from commit a0329a3f86e8bf275dd4e16c1f354911a6ff2eb6)

commit_message:
Dropping lower constraints testing

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this
topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

I propose to drop this test because the complexity and recurring pain needed
to maintain that now exceeds the benefits provided by this mechanismes.

Also removing lower constraints and related tox environment as they are
no longer needed.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html

Conflicts:
  .zuul.yaml
  lower-constraints.txt

NOTE(hberaud): Conflicts are due to different base jobs in zuul and
different constraints in lower-constraints

Change-Id: Icf48ef72fbfff88dda2714b386dbbfe355dc1acb
(cherry picked from commit 686a8b61826d9bed0a989e645a13c708c3e6343c)
(cherry picked from commit 1682ef69ae30732071fb4296f947047c37c4622e)

commit_message:
Update String type for Monasca ES template

This updates the Elasticsearch template used by Monasca to
persist logs so that is uses the 'new' string types [1]. As
an aside it helps to make the template more clear; full text
search for log messages, and keyword searches for everything
else.

[1] https://www.elastic.co/blog/strings-are-dead-long-live-strings

Closes-Bug: #1892376
Change-Id: I0cd6bf22d4695d88d93241da4364d170d8d8c80e
(cherry picked from commit d3e87a2e4d8b2ca6f03d0c19f3f3d619b52d5514)

commit_message:
Lint and fix renos

One of the renos was causing issues due to a duplicated id.
This change makes tox doc8 env lint renos and fixes
the offending reno.

commit_message:
Fix type of direct_mandatory_flag opt

An IntOpt with a default of True is invalid. I'm a little surprised
this doesn't fail a defaults check somewhere, but it needs to be
fixed regardless.

Looking at where it is used, it appears the boolean type is correct.
This just changes the opt type to BoolOpt to match.

Change-Id: I01a38754a31c891f2b3b9c7f8135690693df5d13
Closes-Bug: 1909036
(cherry picked from commit b8f8b17030e93f6fe64e986ebae1de4011f007d5)

commit_message:
Don't display pagination links

Pagination links are not useful in command line outputs and they
shouldn't be displayed.
With this patch we popped them out for share snapshot export_locations
for the following commands:
openstack share snapshots show
manila snapshot-show
openstack share snapshot export location show
manila snapshot-export-location-show

Closes-Bug: #1912704
Change-Id: I5972f3df43f36b6a73f13a26d6748f05959433eb

'}]
commit_message:
Disable RHSM passthrough in UBI

* Hosts with an rhsm subscription can interfere with local testing
* /etc/rhsm-host is symlinked to rhsm config mounted from the host
* This disables it to prevent host repos from mixing with test repos

Change-Id: Ie08c7196dbc1af7429f6904c84b300d4ce08d9a2

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-29 09:37:05.000000000', 'message': "Disallow CONF.compute.max_disk_devices_to_attach = 0

The CONF.compute.max_disk_devices_to_attach option controls the maximum
number of disk devices allowed to attach to an instance. If it is set
to 0, it will literally allow no disk device for instances, preventing
them from being able to boot.

This adds a note to the config option help to call this out and changes
nova-compute to raise InvalidConfiguration during init_host if
[compute]max_disk_devices_to_attach has been set to 0. The nova-compute
service will fail to start if the option is set to 0.

Note: there doesn't appear to be any way to disallow particular values
in a oslo.config IntOpt other than the min/max values. Here we need the
min value to be -1 to represent unlimited. There is a 'choices' kwarg
available but that is only for enumerating valid values and we need to
allow any integer >= 1 as well.

Change-Id: I6e30468bc28f661ddc17937ab1de04a706f05063
Closes-Bug: #1897950
(cherry picked from commit 25a632a4e1daa1941a6297ddb51088972f23ce6d)
"}]
commit_message:
Disallow CONF.compute.max_disk_devices_to_attach = 0

The CONF.compute.max_disk_devices_to_attach option controls the maximum
number of disk devices allowed to attach to an instance. If it is set
to 0, it will literally allow no disk device for instances, preventing
them from being able to boot.

This adds a note to the config option help to call this out and changes
nova-compute to raise InvalidConfiguration during init_host if
[compute]max_disk_devices_to_attach has been set to 0. The nova-compute
service will fail to start if the option is set to 0.

Note: there doesn't appear to be any way to disallow particular values
in a oslo.config IntOpt other than the min/max values. Here we need the
min value to be -1 to represent unlimited. There is a 'choices' kwarg
available but that is only for enumerating valid values and we need to
allow any integer >= 1 as well.

Change-Id: I6e30468bc28f661ddc17937ab1de04a706f05063
Closes-Bug: #1897950
(cherry picked from commit 25a632a4e1daa1941a6297ddb51088972f23ce6d)

commit_message:
Add SITE_PACKAGES variable to horizon extend_start

This change adds a missing export. Without this change the horizon
dashboards are all broken becuase the functions are able to
correctly copy the dashboards plugins to the appropriate locations.

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I5fa3bb41403620e8bd9521e3c0e61570e202148f

commit_message:
Add SCTP support in Amphora

Add SCTP support in the Amphora (with keepalived).
Add amphora-health-checker script for customized SCTP health checks
(INIT/INIT-ACK/ABORT).

Change-Id: I30997ae6cc6b8ec724f0e9dcfdfe49356b320ff4
Story: 2007884
Task: 40932

This change adds vnic type vdpa to the list of supported
vnic types for the ovs and ovn mech drivers.

this change is lacking unit test and is incomplete as a new
per agent config option is required to enable checkign
for switch dev support for vdpa interfaces. this is defered
until after the ptg discussion to adress.

commit_message:
Add support for VNIC type vDPA to ML2/OVS and ML2/OVN

This change adds VNIC type vDPA ("vdpa") to the list of
supported VNIC types for the OVS and OVN mech drivers.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/760043/
Change-Id: If22aedc147f7e2256f8f8ad3bebb80b6bb2f6d3d

In the rocky cycle nova was enhanced to support the multiple
port binding live migration workflow when neutron supports

When the migration_data object was extended to support

commit_message:
Set migrate_data.vifs only when using multiple port bindings

In the rocky cycle nova was enhanced to support the multiple
port binding live migration workflow when neutron supports
the binding-extended API extension.
When the migration_data object was extended to support
multiple port bindings, populating the vifs field was used
as a sentinel to indicate that the new workflow should
be used.

In the train release
I734cc01dce13f9e75a16639faf890ddb1661b7eb
(SR-IOV Live migration indirect port support)
broke the semantics of the migrate_data object by
unconditionally populating the vifs field

This change restores the rocky semantics, which are depended
on by several parts of the code base, by only conditionally
populating vifs if neutron supports multiple port bindings.

Changes to patch:
  - unit/virt/libvirt/fakelibvirt.py: Include partial pick from
    change Ia3d7351c1805d98bcb799ab0375673c7f1cb8848 to add the
    jobStats, complete_job and fail_job to fakelibvirt. The full
    change was not cherry-picked as it was part of the numa aware
    live migration feature in Victoria.

Co-Authored-By: Sean Mooney <work@seanmooney.info>
Change-Id: Ia00277ac8a68a635db85f9e0ce2c6d8df396e0d8
Closes-Bug: #1888395
(cherry picked from commit b8f3be6b3c5af91d215b4a0cecb9be098e8d8799)

commit_message:
tox: Add passenv DISABLE_CHERRY_PICK_CHECK to pep8

I4f551dc4b57905cab8aa005c5680223ad1b57639 introduced the environment
variable to disable the check-cherry-pick.sh script but forgot to allow
it to be passed into the pep8 tox env.

Change-Id: Ie8a672fd21184c810bfe9c0e3a49582189bf2111

commit_message:
Fixes local boot for partition images

IPA is not properly checking if the root partition is already
mounted. Device is being passed to os.path.ismount() instead
of the mount point.

Story: 2008631
Task: 41839
Change-Id: I37a6e7e6bbe0bbbb0317c6e55bb822dafe7cce20
(cherry picked from commit 319efe2c2d323817db86388c47bf06e5c6ff269c)

commit_message:
Add upgrade check about old computes

Report a warning during upgrade checks if there are computes older than
the previous major nova release in the system.

So if code is upgraded to N+1 and the upgrade check was run before
the restart of the services with N+1 code then the check warns for N-1
computes in the system.

Conflicts:
  doc/source/cli/nova-status.rst
  doc/source/install/verify.rst
  nova/cmd/status.py
  nova/tests/unit/cmd/test_status.py

Note: Fixed trivial conflicts due to different amount of upgrade
checks exists on ussuri than on victoria (the patch that is missing
from Ussuri is Ic4d3b998bb9701cb1e3ef12d9bb6f4d91cc19c18). Also needed
to use six.text_type() instead of str() due to used hacking package
(and thus flake8) requires it still on Ussuri.

Related-Bug: #1903545

Change-Id: I873b0c1e6e695ae88241bbf75ac9f80ecc6f5664
(cherry picked from commit 3b8257cd239d0bb52cb654d709cc579ca9841628)
(cherry picked from commit 4e5b92545db5f5434bcfeab90bae1a8555a54dd4)

commit_message:
Enable swift in tempest-full-py3

swift was disabled in tempest-full-py3 as
it was not ready on python3. But since ussuri
or train swift run fine on py3 and we have
tempest storage integrated py3 job also running on
swift gate.

This commit enable swift for ussuri onwards.

Change-Id: I63159e5e8c0c8b6751ea481577b4c4637a7f25b5

commit_message:
use psycopg2 binary instead of source package

this change replaces psycopg2 with psycopg2-binary
to avoid requiring the build depencyies for the postgres client.
instead the tests now use the prebuilt binary wheel.

Change-Id: Id6d920508b9ee9597a51616e66c47d4cb7f48ca0

MySQL / MariaDB's default size of 127M is essentially
universally insufficient, and this variable is typically
better off in the 16-32G range assuming available memory.

Change-Id: Ie274854a73bf6fe3d99e8621175f81c69c9a878a
"}]
commit_message:
Default all innodb_buffer_pool_size to 1G

MySQL / MariaDB's default size of 127M is essentially
universally insufficient, and this variable is typically
better off in the 16-32G range assuming available memory.

commit_message:
add functional regression test for bug #1888395

This change adds a funcitonal regression test that
assert the broken behavior when trying to live migrate
with a neutron backend that does not support multiple port
bindings.

Conflicts/Changes:
  nova/tests/functional/regressions/test_bug_1888395.py:
    - specify api major version to allow block_migration 'auto'
    - use TempDir fixture for instances path
  nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/fake_imagebackend.py:
    - include portion of change Ia3d7351c1805d98bcb799ab0375673c7f1cb8848
      which stubs out the is_file_in_instance_path method. That was
      included in a feature patch set so just pulling the necessary
      bit.

Change-Id: I470a016d35afe69809321bd67359f466c3feb90a
Partial-Bug: #1888395
(cherry picked from commit 71bc6fc9b89535679252ffe5a737eddad60e4102)

commit_message:
Switch to new rolevar for run-temepst role

Tempest replaced the below rolevar for run-tempest role
- tempest_test_blacklist is replaced by tempest_test_exclude_list
- tempest_black_regex is replaced by tempest_exclude_regex

old name are still supported for compatiblity but we recommend
to switch to new one.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/774835
Change-Id: I609c1714a4f630207562a4725456d3d7f87d698e

commit_message:
Remove rootwrap execution (4)

Replace rootwrap execution with privsep context execution.
This series of patches will progressively replace any
rootwrap call.

This patch migrates any "iptables" and "ipset" command related
to privsep.

Change-Id: I4a1e137b2b414067504ad7c799d68f482bf3d36c
Story: #2007686
Task: #41558

commit_message:
Move router gateway deletion out of transaction

Router gateway delete includes callback notification with
AFTER_DELETE event.
Callback manager does not expect it to be called inside transaction
and suppresses retriable DB errors. As a result it may return with
inactive DB session.

Router gw deletion was out of transaction before new engine facade
switch. IMO gw absence is still a valid state for a router that
eventually failed to be deleted for some reason.

Change-Id: Iba868be4d6da4d5ed12effd6705771e9a798a677
Closes-Bug: #1915271
